SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
EINSTEIN SEARCH
Getting Insights with Search Analytics (Pilot)

Discover actionable insights with Search Analytics. Build dashboards to analyze your data. Use insights to make changes to the search engine, optimize content, and train users.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Data Cloud in Lightning Experience

NOTE This feature isn’t generally available and is being piloted with certain Customers subject to additional terms and conditions. It is not part of your purchased Services. This feature is subject to change, may be discontinued with no notice at any time in SFDC’s sole discretion, and SFDC may never make this feature generally available. Make your purchase decisions only on the basis of generally available products and features. This feature is made available on an AS IS basis and use of this feature is at your sole risk.

Search Analytics works on Data Cloud with Data Lake Objects (DLOs), Data Model Objects (DMOs), and Calculated Insights (CIs). We provide a dashboard to view trends in your data. You can also build custom reports and dashboards for your Search Analytics data.

How Does Search Analytics Work?

Search Analytics gathers events from search-related logs and computes metrics based on these events. You can analyze these events and metrics in Data Cloud through DMOs and CIs.

Events are either user actions or system actions. Search Analytics gathers these events.

Queries—the user executes a query.
Impressions—the system shows the search results.
Interactions—the user interacts with a search result.

Metrics are aggregated over events and computed by using formulas. For example, some available metrics are the number of clicked articles and the mean reciprocal rank of the results that were interacted with. Search Analytics provides several metrics, but you can also create your own from the provided events.

Search Analytics Dashboard

Use the dashboard to view trends in your data.

See graphs about queries (1), such as the number of queries per search feature. 
See graphs about results (2), such as the percentage of queries with results per day.
See graphs about interactions (3), such as the most interacted queries.
Enable Search Analytics (Pilot)
To use Search Analytics, you need a Data Cloud license and Data Cloud credits.
Access the Search Analytics Dashboard (Pilot)
Search Analytics provides a dashboard to analyze data about search in your Salesforce org. The dashboard contains graphs to view trends about queries and articles.
Create a Case Closure Calculated Insight (Pilot)
Create a calculated insight (CI) with case-related metrics by using example SQL expressions. Use the CI to see how many interactions happen before the case is closed, to analyze case-related metrics and build dashboards on the CI.
Search Analytics Considerations (Pilot)
Keep a few considerations in mind when using Search Analytics.
Search Analytics Reference (Pilot)
Learn about the Data Model Objects (DMOs) and calculated insights that Search Analytics uses.
